question: [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: save_result()] [TOCTOU race] Is there a time-of-check-time-of-use race between when the error map is generated and when it's written to disk, allowing an attacker to modify the output file between these operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: name_string()] [Symbol pool pollution] Can an attacker inject malicious symbols into the GlobalEnv's symbol pool that get included in error code names without sanitization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: build_error_categories()] [Code name injection] The code_name field is set directly from constant name without validation - can attackers use special characters, newlines, or control characters to break error map parsing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: build_error_categories()] [Description injection] The code_description is taken directly from get_doc() - can malicious documentation strings containing newlines, escape sequences, or format specifiers corrupt the error map file format? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: build_error_map_for_module()] [Prefix bypass with unicode] Can attackers use Unicode lookalike characters or zero-width characters in constant names to bypass the starts_with(error_prefix) check? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: build_error_map_for_module()] [Full name injection] The get_full_name_str() is used as the module identifier - can attackers craft module names with special characters that break error map parsing or lookup? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: name_string()] [Rc memory leak] The method returns Rc<String> - can repeated calls to name_string() for the same symbols cause reference count buildup and memory leaks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Struct: ErrmapOptions] [Empty error prefix] Can error_prefix be set to empty string, and does this cause all constants to be treated as error codes regardless of naming conventions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Struct: ErrmapOptions] [Malformed prefix] Can error_prefix contain regex metacharacters or wildcards that cause unexpected matching behavior in starts_with()? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Struct: ErrmapOptions] [Output extension bypass] The default output_file uses MOVE_ERROR_DESC_EXTENSION - can attackers override this with a different extension to bypass file type checks in downstream tools? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Struct: ErrmapOptions] [Category module override] Can error_category_module option be used to specify a different module name than 'error', allowing attackers to designate arbitrary modules as error category sources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: new()] [Unvalidated options] The constructor takes ErrmapOptions without validation - can malformed options cause undefined behavior in subsequent operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: gen()] [Untrusted GlobalEnv] If GlobalEnv contains malicious or malformed module data, is there sufficient validation before processing, or can bad data corrupt the error mapping? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: gen()] [Module count DoS] Can an attacker provide a GlobalEnv with thousands or millions of modules to exhaust memory or CPU during error map generation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: build_error_categories()] [Constant count DoS] Can a malicious 'error' module contain millions of named constants to cause quadratic time complexity or memory exhaustion when building error categories? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: build_error_map_for_module()] [Constant iteration DoS] Can modules with extremely large numbers of error constants cause performance degradation or timeout during error map generation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: get_abort_code()] [BigInt conversion DoS] Can extremely large BigInt values (e.g., 2^1024) in error constants cause exponential time complexity in the try_from conversion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Function: save_result()] [File size DoS] Can an attacker generate an error map so large it fills up disk space or exceeds filesystem limits when written to output_file? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/move-errmapgen/src/errmapgen.rs] [Struct: ErrmapGen] [Memory accumulation] Does the ErrorMapping accumulate unbounded data as modules are processed, or is there a size limit to prevent memory exhaustion? (Medium)
